poem:
Title: "Cotton Winds and Iron Tracks"

Trains at standstill,
grist for the spectral mill-
in Wales, England's west,
Midlands' unquiet rest.

Swiss pennies drop,
economic pulses stop-
Yet, the world turns still
in its borrowed will.

Czech, Hungarian plight,
Riksbank's twilight flight-
each a note in the silent song,
of infinite pecuniary throng.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Train strikes halt most services in west of England, Midlands and routes to Scotland and Wales – business live 9.04am BST The Swiss National Bank was the first major central bank in the developed world to cut borrowing costs, lowering its key rate from 1.75% to 1.5% in March, in a surprise move. The Czech and Hungarian central banks have also cut interest rates. Sweden’s Riksbank has now also reduced rates, as inflation and economic". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
